page.title: 17THE MAYOR SPEAKS (2)
page.content:
The hippies were friendly, and I felt they could have started a circus from the jugglers and musicians who were performing that glorious afternoon. My incognito was shattered when the Earl of Cardigan, who had given them permission to stay in the forest temporarily, arrived, followed by large numbers of journalists who wanted 'a statement'. The departure of the hippies was something which pleased the people of Marlborough, although I thought they had handled it well.
Doubtless we shall talk of this for years to come!
